questions.question: What is the first step in the scientific method?
Which of the following is not a characteristic of living organisms?
What is the function of the eyepiece in a microscope?
Which scientist is known for developing the theory of evolution by natural selection?
What is the basic unit of life?
Which of the following is a prokaryotic organism?
What does the term "biodiversity" refer to?
options: The variety of life in an ecosystem
questions.correct: The variety of life in an ecosystem

questions.question: Which part of the microscope is used to adjust the amount of light?
What is the purpose of a control in an experiment?
Which of the following is an example of a unicellular organism?
What is aquaculture?
Which of the following is a method of fish preservation?
What is the primary goal of fish farming?
options: To provide a sustainable food source
questions.correct: To provide a sustainable food source

questions.question: Which factor is most important in maintaining water quality in fish farming?
What is the process of removing fish from water for processing called?
Which of the following is a common disease in fish farming?
What is the purpose of fish grading in processing?
Which conservation method involves protecting fish habitats?
What is the term for the practice of catching fish in a way that maintains the population?
Which of the following is a benefit of fish farming?
options: Reduced pressure on wild fish populations
questions.correct: Reduced pressure on wild fish populations

questions.question: What is the function of the cell membrane?
options: To control what enters and leaves the cell
questions.correct: To control what enters and leaves the cell

questions.question: Which organelle is known as the "powerhouse" of the cell?
What is the main difference between plant and animal cells?
What is the process by which cells divide to form two identical daughter cells?
Which of the following is not a type of tissue?
What is the function of ribosomes in a cell?
Which structure contains the cell’s genetic material?
What is the term for the movement of water across a semi-permeable membrane?
Which of the following is a characteristic of eukaryotic cells?
What is the role of chloroplasts in plant cells?
Which of the following is a characteristic of mammals?
What is the process by which plants make their own food?
Which group of organisms includes bacteria and archaea?
What is the term for organisms that can make their own food?
Which of the following is an example of a symbiotic relationship?
What is the primary function of the respiratory system in animals?
Which of the following is a characteristic of insects?
What is the term for the process by which organisms change over time?
Which of the following is a type of asexual reproduction?
What is the role of decomposers in an ecosystem?
options: To break down dead organic matter
questions.correct: To break down dead organic matter

questions.question: What is an ecosystem?
options: A group of organisms of the same species
A community of organisms and their environment
questions.correct: A community of organisms and their environment

questions.question: Which of the following is an abiotic factor in an ecosystem?
What is the term for the position an organism occupies in a food chain?
Which of the following is a primary consumer?
What is the process by which nitrogen is converted into a usable form for plants?
Which of the following is a greenhouse gas?
What is the term for the maximum number of individuals an environment can support?
Which of the following is an example of a renewable resource?
What is the primary cause of deforestation?
Which of the following is a consequence of pollution?
What is a pathogen?
Which of the following is a vector for disease transmission?
What is the term for the body’s natural defense against disease?
Which of the following is a sexually transmitted infection?
What is the primary way to prevent the spread of infectious diseases?
Which of the following is a non-communicable disease?
What is the term for the study of the distribution and determinants of health-related events?
Which of the following is a symptom of malaria?
What is the role of antibiotics in treating infections?
Which of the following is a method of controlling disease vectors?

questions.part: Introduction to Biology, the Scientific Method, Organisms and Microscope
questions.question: Explain the steps of the scientific method and provide an example of how it can be applied in a biological experiment.
Discuss the importance of fish farming in providing a sustainable food source. Include at least three benefits and two challenges.
Describe the structure and function of the cell membrane. How does it contribute to the maintenance of homeostasis in the cell?
Compare and contrast the characteristics of prokaryotic and eukaryotic organisms. Provide examples of each.
Explain the concept of a food chain and a food web. How do they differ, and why are food webs more representative of real ecosystems?
Discuss the role of vectors in the transmission of diseases. Provide examples of two diseases and their respective vectors.

a) Define the term "ecosystem" and explain its components. b) Describe the flow of energy through an ecosystem, including the roles of producers, consumers, and decomposers. c) Discuss the impact of human activities on ecosystems and suggest ways to mitigate these impacts.
Explain the process of mitosis and its significance in the growth and repair of organisms.
Describe the process of photosynthesis, including the reactants and products. Why is it important for life on Earth?
Discuss the importance of vaccination in preventing infectious diseases. How do vaccines work, and what are some challenges in vaccine development?
